result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Wayne Weil

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Dec 12;  ka

8:01 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Preston James Smead appeared by video for Jordan Wayne Weil.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CF140 and 22CF100.  Case 22CF140 is here for prelim hearing.  Atty, waiver of prelim hearing.  Def has discussed with Atty, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint finds PC that def committed a felony in Ashland County.  Case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now.  Atty, recv'd copy of information, waive reading, pleading NG, noted.  Add 22CF16 to the STC.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on October 13;  ka
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.

9:09 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance Smead.  Recv'd compliant, waives reading, asking for prelim hearing.  22CF100 here for STC, State sent letter, court reviewing now.  State would like to track along with prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:00 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Preston James Smead appeared by video for Jordan Wayne Weil.  Attorney waiving preliminary hearing.  Def discussed with attorney, understands rights giving up when waiving preliminary hearing.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied def is knowing, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right to preliminary hearing and accepts waiver.  Probable cause that a felony was committed in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State filed information, contains the same charges as the criminal compliant.  Attorney arraignment now, reviewed charges and penalties, waives reading, 
pleads NG, pleas noted.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061580,
Payable Number: 82383,
Receipt Number: 22R 003616,
Amount: $20.00

10:14 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Preston Smead is attorney.  Atty was not aware of case.  Def has received a copy of criminal compliant, waives reading of compliant.  Attorney waiving time limits for preliminary hearing, def agrees.  Court is satisfied that knowingly, willing waiving time limits.  State will be ready anytime after 10 days.  Attorney is ok with that.  Can zoom, def can appear by zoom, with video or stipulation regarding identification, otherwise has to appear in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:00 am.
